fields.summary: Browser compatibility message link to Supported Platforms is broken on OnDemand

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Customers who utilized uTest Cloud Connection for JIRA is no longer able to click on More > Manage Application Links to link the issue back to uTest

Since the uTest [Cloud connectors|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/Cloud+connectors+removal+in+JIRA+Cloud] was removed from JIRA Cloud, this option should not be available

Rather than being able to remove the uTest Cloud Connector, the following message appears under Cloud Connectors > Connections:
{quote}The specified system "utest" is current unavailable
The required plugin is currently not installed, please visit the Product Documentation Page for details on how to install this into your system{quote}

h3. Environment
* 7.0.0-OD-01 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Customer attempts steps to link a [JIRA Issue to a uTest Bug|https://docs-old.servicerocket.com/display/UTJIRA00/JIRA+Functionality]
#- From an issue, click on the *More* menu-button and select *Manage Application Links*

h3. Expected Results
Since the Cloud Connector for uTest has been removed, the option should not be available 

h3. Actual Results
Customer is able to click on the More > Manage Application Links from a JIRA issue however it fails and presents an error:
{noformat}
An error occurred whilst rendering this message. Please contact the administrators, and inform them of this bug. Details: ------- org.apache.velocity.exception.MethodInvocationException: Invocation of method 'getSupportSearch' in class 
{noformat}

JIRA Logs show:
{noformat}
ERROR sysadmin 766x5056x1 142995s  /secure/ViewConnectorLinks.jspa [c.atlassian.velocity.DefaultVelocityManager] MethodInvocationException occurred getting message body from Velocity: java.lang.NullPointerException
@4000000055db4a540a7b24c4 java.lang.NullPointerException
{noformat}
 
h3. Notes
(Optional - If Necessary)

h3.Workaround
no workaround
fields.summary: Manage Application Links Option Still Available in JIRA after uTest Cloud Connector Removal

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Using Google Federated Account, user cannot access WedDav in JIRA Cloud.

h3. Suggested Solution

For user to be able to log into the webdav with Google Federated Account. No need to reset or use the local JIRA password if authenticated via Google.

h3. Workaround 

Current workaround is for user to login with USERNAME and LOCAL JIRA PASSWORD, even if user is already authenticated via Google Federated Account. If user didn't set up a password or doesn't recall password, a password reset need to take place to access WedDav.

*Additional problem with Workaround*: If user reset their Local JIRA password, the Google Federated Account link no longer works. User will need to have their password reset to allow Google Federated Account to work again. This is inconvenient for the user to access webdav when using Google Federated Login.
fields.summary: Using Google Federated Account to Log into WedDav

fields.description:
*Steps to reproduce*
# open the _Create Issues_ window
# click *Configure Fields > Where is my field?*
# select any field from the dropdown

An error is thrown:
{quote}The JIRA server was contacted but has returned an error response. We are unsure of the result of this operation.{quote}

!https://s3.amazonaws.com/uploads.hipchat.com/10804/51242/SiDnhbEXms9fUKv/Screen%20Shot%202014-11-10%20at%2012.53.45%20pm.png!

No error is written to the log file.

Chrome's developer tools show an error: 400 Bad Request. Clicking on the error on the developer tools, at the Preview tab, there's the following message:{code}Either 'issueKey', or 'projectKey' or 'projectId' parameter must be provided in the request{code}See screenshots of the errors.
fields.summary: "Where is my field?" throws an error in the Create Issue window

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When you have a browser window being smaller than the dialogue box, then you can not scroll down.

h3. Steps to Reproduce 
# Link an issue to the current issue
# make vertical size of browser window smaller than the dialogue box
# try to navigate to the buttons at the bottom of the dialogue box.
 
h3. Expected Results
If the dialogue box exceeds the size of the screen, then scrolling should allow users seeing whe whole box

h3. Actual Results
 The bottom of the dialogue boxes is hidden

h3. Workarounds
Set a lower zoom on the browser
fields.summary: Can not scroll on dialogue boxes

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When an issue collector is configured to use an issue type that uses a field scheme that does not contain the description or environment fields, a warning is displayed indicating the collector will not record all data submitted on the form. A link is provided to the fields configuration page to correct this but the link has invalid syntax and results in a 404 not found page.

h3. Environment
Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Edit the default field configuration and hide the description and environment fields
# Create an issue collector and select an issue type that uses the default field configuration
# Click submit and then view the issue collectors page
# Note the warning that is displayed which includes a link to the Fields page to correct the missing fields.

h3. Expected Results
The link to the fields configuration page will direct the user to the correct page to resolve the missing fields.

The link will uses the URL https://<hostname>/plugins/servlet/project-config/<project key>/fields

h3. Actual Results
The link results in a 404 not found error using the following URL
https://<hostname>/secure/%22/plugins/servlet/project-config/<project key>/fields%22

h3.Workaround
Use any other navigation method to reach the field configuration page. The Fields link in the project admin menu to the left works fine.
fields.summary: Issue Collector Warning Field Link Invalid URL

fields.description:
Our developers integrate JIRA in Webstorm and PHPstorm and this causes a repeated logging out of the JIRA if opened in a browser. 


h3. Steps to Repro

# Open a Jetbrains IDE.  Install the Atlassian connector.  Configure it to point to your cloud instance.  Make it fetch some issues from the Atlassian panel just to confirm it is working.
# Close your Jetbrains IDE product.
# Open your Chrome browser (all browsers will suffer, but I've witnessed this on Chrome), sign into your Atlassian Cloud instance, making sure to _remember me_. 
# Close your browser completely.  Open the browser back up and confirm that navigating to your Atlassian cloud instance automatically signs you in.  Navigate to an issue of your choice...doesn't matter what.
# With the browser still open, now reopen your Jetbrains IDE product.  Let it load completely.  Heck even go check out the issues in your Atlassian panel within the IDE.
# Now return to your browser that has the JIRA issue open.  Try to perform a restricted operation, e.g. edit a comment.  You should be told that you don't have permission.  Now click on the issue's link at the top of the issue page and notice you're bounced to the Atlassian cloud sign in page.
fields.summary: Integrating JIRA in Webstorm, you are logged out of JIRA

It has the Version "6.4-OD-11-012" (which is not available in the affects versions picker).

Inspecting the URL (used by the JIRA issues  macro) shows that using that URL as an authenticated user works fine, but fails for anonymous users when it contains "fixVersion" with a NullPointerException. This makes the JIRA issues macro quite unuseable for all external use cases.

fields.description:
StudioDataImportAsyncCommand starts in different thread so the authenticationContext does not have the current logged in user. We have to set the current "loggedInUser" in the authenticationContext in order to delete applinks.

During the  StudioDataImportAsyncCommand we do a few things.
JIRA import, restart JIRA, plugins gets started, background tasks gets started. 

Because the directory synch order is not guaranteed it is possible that the current user in authenticationContext is not the correct user (user does not have the correct directory ID) and could fail to delete and setup applinks. Permission is needed to delete old applinks (applinks are deleted as they are not valid in cloud). The applinks is used for data synch from JIRA to UM.
Example:
If you login to studio with user "studdy" user exist in CROWD directory (horde) with directory ID 10000.
User performs the import, during import JIRA's db gets wiped and restored with the imported data.
At some point the user directory gets synched and the current logged in user's directory ID could change. 
See https://jdog.jira-dev.com/browse/HIROL-1305 for exact details.

So when we perform the permission check the users directory is used and that could be the old directory id.

h5. So what is wrong with the synching?

After JIRA import (*1) JIRA gets restarted. Plugins gets started (*2) and the background tasks (*3) gets started. 

(*2) On restart the bean EmbeddedCrowdDirectoryMaintainerImpl startups and tries to configure crowd remove directory.
(*3) The import starts the asynch task via
com.atlassian.jira.bc.dataimport.DefaultDataImportService#startAsyncServices 
This starts the JiraDirectorySynchroniser
(*1) The StudioDataImportAsyncCommand also does a synch in com.atlassian.jira.studio.importer.StudioImporterService#postImportStudify

We are not guaranteed the the synch has completed, but its more likely after postImportStudify
com.atlassian.jira.studio.importer.StudioDataImportAsyncCommand#importJiraExportData

h5. So what need to happen?
# We should not need a user to remove applinks. This has to be solved by app links team.
com.atlassian.applinks.core.DefaultEntityLinkService#deleteEntityLinksFor calls hosts 
com.atlassian.applinks.host.spi.InternalHostApplication#getLocalEntities
and it requires "every entity in the local instance visible to the currently logged in user"
so JIRA does a permission check in 
com.atlassian.jira.applinks.JiraAppLinksHostApplication#getLocalEntities
----
Ideally they should call new method com.atlassian.applinks.host.spi.InternalHostApplication#getLocalEntitiesNoAuth that does not require auth.
# com.atlassian.jira.studio.importer.StudioImporterService#postImportStudify
should wait for synch if one is in progress. Currently because of other potential Thread this is not guaranteed.


h4. When you make the change.
See
com.atlassian.jira.studio.importer.StudioDataImportAsyncCommand#doStudioImportTasks
{code}
// There is still a bug here that needs solving in JDEV-34007
final StudioImporterContext studioImporterContext = studioImporterService.postImportStudify();
{code}
fields.summary: Studio Import Directory Synch not guaranteed

fields.description:
Filters are not working properly because of JQL searches not returning the correct results.
This causes many Agile Boards to not show or display incorrect issues.

It seems to be affecting JQL using the *NOT* keyword.

We are currently investigating and working on getting it resolved.

*Workaround:*
As a temporary workaround JIRA can be restarted to restore JQL functionality. OnDemand customers, please contact Support at [support.atlassian.com|https://support.atlassian.com]

*Possible Bug Variance*
JQL like {{labels = <JQL here> ORDER BY Rank ASC}} is also affected.
fields.summary: JQL not properly searching issues
Creating issues though API allows you to set an invalid security level for the issue

h3. Summary
In JIRA Cloud {{7.0.0-OD-02}}, the *Harvest* add-on keeps enabling automatically after each weekly maintenance. 

h3. Environment
* JIRA Cloud 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Navigate to *Manage add-ons*
# Search for *Harvest* add-on
# Disable the *Harvest* add-on

h3. Expected Results
*Harvest* add-on is disabled

h3. Actual Results
Even after disabling the add-on, it is enabled after each weekly maintenance window
 
h3.Workaround
Customers need to disable this add-on every Monday and this is very inconvenient.
fields.summary: Harvest Add-on enables automatically after weekly maintenance

fields.description:
{panel:title=Update as of 17 September July 2015|bgColor=#f5f5f5}
Hi everyone,
We shipped some improvements in how attachments can be added this week and here's the new pieces we added:
* Drag and drop functionality: Grab files from anywhere and drop them to an issue.
* Copy and paste: You can now paste files directly to an issue too.

As part of this, we decided to remove the Attach Screenshot option to simplify the menu. But the functionality remains unchanged, i.e. you can still take screenshots with the same keyboard and then just paste on to the issue. You will get the same dialog where you can rename the screenshot.
Thanks for letting us know your thoughts as always!
Cheers,
Lingbo
{panel}

Link to issue navigator should filter by assignee

Sends you to issue navigator with all the issues (JQL filtering for nothing) or the last known search

Manually entering JQL or searching for issues

fields.description:
*Steps to Reproduce:*
# Create an issue (e.g. Test1)
# Add an unreleased version to it
# Click on Close Issue (but before closing it, add e.g. 10m on the work log)
# Close the issue.
# Run the following query:
{code}project = "YourProjectName" AND status = Closed AND timeestimate is EMPTY AND fixVersion = earliestUnreleasedVersion(){code}
# Create another issue (e.g. Test2)
# Add an unreleased version to it
# Add work log to it
# Close the issue
# Run the following query again
{code}project = "YourProjectName" AND status = Closed AND timeestimate is EMPTY AND fixVersion = earliestUnreleasedVersion(){code}

*Expected Results:*
# Both issues should show up when the last query is run.

*Actual Results:*
# Only the first issue is shown.

*Workaround:*
None found at this point.

*Notes:*
[Documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AOD/Advanced+Searching] says that {{timeEstimate}} is an alias for {{remainingEstimate}}. Therefor, it should search for issues where the Remaining Estimate is set to a particular value (i.e. a number, not a date or date range). Though, when searching for:
{code}project = "YourProjectName" AND status = Closed AND remainingEstimate = 0 AND fixVersion = earliestUnreleasedVersion(){code}
None of the issues created above show up.
fields.summary: Query with Time Tracking is failing depending on how you log work

fields.description:
*Steps to Reproduce:*
1)Log into JIRA
2)Click on Cog Icon > System
3)On the left menu choose Global Permissions
4)Click on Permission Schemes under the Global Permissions section in the beggining of the page
5)Click on Default EPrmission Scheme under Name column
6)Click on Grant Permission (first option at the beggining of the page)
7)On Permissions box select Browse Projects
8)Select Group bullet field and in the DropDown menu besides it leave Anyone option selected
9)Click Add button at the bottom of the page
10)Now that we set JIRA projects as public for browsing, please log out.
11)Try to access the JIRA page using browser in your PC
12)Now try to access same URL using your mobile phone

*Expected Results:*
Using mobile phone, browser, tablets or other devices default Dashboard must show

*Actual Results:*
When browsing using a mobile phone we are redirected to the login page not being able to browse it anonymously

*Workaround:*
There is no workaround. It's not possible to access projects anonymously through mobile phone
fields.summary: Mobile phone users can't browse anonymously public JIRA projects

fields.description:
The following page https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/associating-issue-types-with-projects-686860781.html#notfound

indicates that there are Default Issue types out of the box with JIRA and this is no longer the case.

JIRA comes with no issue types and they issue types are added by projects or manually by the administrator.

Because JIRA Cloud doesn't always comes with JIRA Agile, users can't find Development issue types such as Bug, Feature Request, etc. that used to come with JIRA by default.

Documentation needs to be updated to clarify on that.

Thanks :)
fields.summary: Issue Types documentation needs to be updated

Full Details noted here:
https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/ONDEMANDKB/label+with+%27jira_%27+at+the+begenning+gets+added+then+instantly+removes+itself

h3.Setps to reproduce:
# enable Atlassian Connect Zendesk plugin
# add a label to an issue with "jira_" at the beginning

h3.Expected Behavior
label is added to the issue

h3.Actual behavior
the label is added to the Issue in the DB then Immediately removed by Zendesk plugin

Disabling Zendesk allows use of "jira_" labels
OR
Do not use labels eith "jira_" at the begenning

h3.Examples:
# Labels that vanish:
- "jira_test"
- "jira__test"
- "jira_skjdhfksjh"
# Labels that do not vanish
- "test_jira_" 
- "jiratesting"
- "testjira_"
- "test_akjlsdhgkjsdhf"
fields.summary: label with 'jira_' at the begenning gets added then instantly removes itself when zendesk is enabled

fields.description:
h3. Problem

When a user is created during issues import from bitbucket, the user created in Jira is without email defined although the user account in bitbucket has an email address defined.
Admin is not able to update the user email from the user management page after the user is created.
Due to the email is not defined the user is not able to receive email to reset their password. The Admin will have to reset the password for the user.

This is replicable by importing bitbucket issues to JIRA through *Import external projects* page.
Then when the Jira admin want to edit the email address for the user from jira user management page, nothing happen when you click save on the edit windows.


h3. Workaround
The user can log into their account to update their email from the profile page. After the email is filled in from profile page, the update email function from the user management page will be working again. :)
fields.summary: Not able to update Jira user's email where user created during bitbucket issues import

fields.description:
h4.Summary

There is currently an issue where it is not possible for Russian customers to log work via Tempo. Due to outdated timezone data on the system; attempting to log work with Tempo will result in an error page.

!tempo.png|thumbnail!

h4.Steps to Replicate 
Just grab a Russian instance and try logging work via Tempo.

h4.Expected Result
Working hours logged.

h4.Current Result
Error page shows when attempting to log work.

h4.Workaround (suggested by Tempo)

{quote}
One possible solution is to restart the JIRA instance with this option:
"-Duser.timezone=Europe/Tallinn". That might however cause problems in the autumn as Tallinn respects Daylight Saving, whereas Moscow does not. 
{quote}

* Change the system timezone to Tallinn. If user wants an immediate fix; this workaround can be fixed; but it should not be a permanent fix.

{quote}
A confirmed fix for this problem (instead of the Tallinn workaround) is to update the tzdate to at least tzdata2015a. This will need to be done by Atlassian Support. These pages includes more information: http://www.oracle.com/technetwork/java/javase/tzdata-versions-138805.html, http://www.oracle.com/us/technologies/java/tzupdater-readme-136440.html
{quote}

* Update to the latest tzdata. (Preferred workaround by Tempo)

h4.Notes
Tempo raised a bug ticket regarding this at https://tempoplugin.jira.com/browse/TT-2211 . Tempo suggested to upgrade the timezone data. Do check the ticket out for more information.

Couldn't link the HOT ticket for some reason....So here it is.

https://ops.internal.atlassian.com/jira/browse/HOT-30183
fields.summary: Timezone in Russia causing Tempo to fail

fields.description:
*UPDATE*

All JIRA Cloud instances should now be fixed. If the problem is still occurring please let Support know at https://support.atlassian.com

*Summary*

Atlassian Connect add-ons such as Zephyr for JIRA have stopped functioning after the upgrade performed on the 17th of August. This is caused by the Atlassian Connect add-on being disabled.

*Workaround*

If you need assistance please log a support ticket at https://support.atlassian.com and we will perform a workaround for you.
fields.summary: Atlassian Connect add-ons disabled after 17th of August upgrade (e.g. Zephyr)

fields.description:
How to reproduce:
# Go to EAN (https://ecosystem.atlassian.net)
# Edit an issue, or create a new issue
# Look at the new formatting bar. Ooh, ahh :)
# Select multiple lines
# Select the "Strikethrough" formatting option
# Preview and notice the lack of strikethrough

I guess this feature should either be disabled for multiple lines, or it should place the hyphens at the beginning and end of each line. Eg:

This is what I get at the moment:
{noformat}
-foo
bar
baz-
{noformat}

This would actually work:
{noformat}
-foo-
-bar-
-baz-
{noformat}
fields.summary: New JIRA formatting bar doesn't work with multi-line strikethrough

Uploading attachment "Discussions-Tue, 05 Aug 2014 01:28:23 GMT.log" (43 chars) to tenant "jira:15489595" on issue "AHD-2"
Received HTTP code 500 from attempt to upload attachment "Discussions-Tue, 05 Aug 2014 01:28:23 GMT.log" (43 characters) to tenant "jira:15489595" on issue "AHD-2". Messages: none.
{noformat}

Node code (in an atlassian-connect-express app):

{code}
            console.log('Uploading attachment "' + filename + '" (' + attachmentContent.length + ' chars) to tenant "' + req.session.clientKey + '" on issue "' + issueKey + '"');

            getHttpClient(req, userKey).post( {
                url: '/rest/api/2/issue/' + issueKey + '/attachments',
                headers: {
                    'X-Atlassian-Token': 'nocheck'
                },
                form: {
                    file: [
                        attachmentContent,
                        {
                            filename: filename,
                            contentType: 'text/plain'
                        }
                    ]
                }
            }, function(err, res/*, body*/) {

                var fileDescription = 'attachment "' + filename + '" (' + attachmentContent.length + ' characters)';

                function fail() {
                    var errorMessage = 'JIRA rejected our attempt to upload ' + fileDescription + '.';
                    var responseCode = res ? res.statusCode : null;
                    deferred.resolve({'filename': null, 'isError': true, 'errorMessage': errorMessage, 'responseCode': responseCode});
                }

                if (err || !res) {
                    console.log('Bad response from uploading to JIRA: err=' + JSON.stringify(err) + ', res=' + JSON.stringify(res));

                    // On EAN we often get this error when uploading an attachment, but actually it often succeeds
                    if (err && 'HPE_INVALID_CONSTANT' == err.code) {
                        queryAttachmentExistence(req, userKey, issueKey, filename).then(function(exists) {
                            if (exists) {
                                // it actually succeeded!
                                console.log('... but the attachment "' + filename + '" exists, so it must have been uploaded. JIRA lied to us! Continuing.');
                                deferred.resolve({'filename':filename, 'isError':false, 'responseCode':res.statusCode});
                            }
                            else {
                                // it really did fail
                                fail();
                            }
                        });
                    }
                    else {
                        fail();
                    }
                }
                else if (res.statusCode < 200 || res.statusCode >= 300) {
                    var errorMessages = 'none.';
                    try {
                        var body = JSON.parse(res.body);
                        errorMessages = body && body['errorMessages'] ? body['errorMessages'] : 'none.';
                    }
                    catch (error) {}

                    var messagePrefix = 'Received HTTP code ' + res.statusCode + ' from attempt to upload ' + fileDescription + ' to ';
                    console.log(messagePrefix + 'tenant "' + req.session.clientKey + '" on issue "' + issueKey + '". Messages: ' + errorMessages);
                    var clientErrorMessage = 500 == res.statusCode ? 'JIRA had an internal error on our attempt to upload ' + fileDescription + '.' : messagePrefix + 'JIRA';
                    deferred.resolve({'filename':null, 'isError':true, 'errorMessage': clientErrorMessage, 'responseCode': res.statusCode});
                }
                else {
                    deferred.resolve({'filename':filename, 'isError':false, 'responseCode':res.statusCode});
                }
            });
{code}

Precise JIRA version: 6.4-OD-03-008#64001-sha1:809dc19

This has also been reported by the external develper Neeraj Bodhe at https://groups.google.com/forum/#!topic/atlassian-connect-dev/OX-tOQksMro .

fields.description:
The default JIRA OnDemand dashboard comes with a *Guide for JIRA Administrators* Gadget. At the bottom of the gadget shows the instance license.

However the license does not reflect the real customer’s OnDemand Billing license but shows the date from a year of 2083 for example:
{quote}Support and updates available until *28/Aug/83*{quote}

It should reflect the Customer’s OnDemand Billing License.

*Workaround:*
The Banner can be hidden by [Configuring the Default Dashboard|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRACLOUD/Configuring+the+Default+Dashboard] and removing the "Guide for JIRA Administrators" gadget.
fields.summary: Atlassian OnDemand Subscription showing wrong license date

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Users cannot change the project lead on projects that exceed the 'Maximum Project Key size' setting.

h3. Environment
JIRA v1000.35.1

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Open a project that exceeds the 'Maximum Project Key size' 
# Click on 'Project Administration'
# Click on 'Users and Roles'
# Click on 'Edit Defaults'
# Enter a new project lead then click on 'Update'
#* Nothing happens, the pop up remains open
 
h3. Expected Results
Project lead should be updated

h3. Actual Results
Nothing happens.
 
3. Notes
It appears to be the case that updates to the project are being rejected because of validation failures. Unfortunately it does not seem like these errors are being reported back to the UI. 

h3.Workaround
In these cases the validation can be relaxed by increasing the 'Maximum Project Key size' setting in the 'General Configuration' admin screen.
fields.summary: Cannot change project lead on projects that exceed the 'Maximum Project Key size' setting

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Reloading page causes comment previews to fail

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a new JIRA Issue
# Add a new comment to the issue
# Editing the comment and Previewing before reloading the page works as intended.
#  Reload the page and click to edit the comment
# Attempting to Preview the comment fails

h3. Expected Results
Comment preview displayed

h3. Actual Results
Preview not working

h3.Workaround
Not reloading the page.
fields.summary: Reloading page causes comment previews to fail

fields.description:
Using jira cloud, recently, tooltips have starting showing up.
Unfortunately, they remain in place forever, often coney zero informaiton and are quite annoying as they hide what's behind.
See attached image:
The tooltip appears. It remains there forever. Switching windows, I somehow managed to have it remain and another one is shown when I select another row.

Expected:
1/ No tooltip at all because really, it's useless. I mean, the name is in hte second column, and I want to see it anyway.
2/ Don't hide what's above. The priority field of the issue just above is partially hidden. If you have to put a tooltip, put it somewhere where it doesn't hide stuff.
3/ Ideally, allow us to not have any of these tooltips anywhere. I just never want to see them anywhere I saw them pop up.
fields.summary: Wrong (and annoying) tooltip display

The preview button in the wiki editor (cloud) does not have a tool-tip.

h3. Reproduction Steps

 # Go to an issue.
 # Edit the description field
 # Hover over the preview icon on bottom right of the editor.

h3. Expected Results

No tool-tip is shown.

Does not affect the new editor in JIRA Server (7.2.0 +) as this button is not present in this editor.

fields.description:
h3. Summary
The links to "other applications" are missing from JIRA cog wheel dropdown menu. The links to the other applications (e.g. Confluence) are correctly showing in the Navigation menu


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Log into JIRA, click on the cog wheel icon (upper right corner) and see that there are only the voices: *JIRA Administration* and *Site Administration*
 !JIRA-cog-wheel-menu.png|thumbnail! 
# Click on the navigation menu (upper left corner) and see that the link to Confluence (and other applications if applicable) is there.
 !JIRA-Navigation-Menu.png|thumbnail! 
# Navigate to Confluence, click on the cog wheel icon and see that the voice *Other Applications* is  present and JIRA is showing in there.
 !Confluence-cog-wheel-menu.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results
The voice *Other Applications* is shown and Confluence is in there.

h3. Actual Results
The voice is missing.
 

h3.Workaround
Use the application navigator

fields.description:
h3. Problem 
After user perform a migration from JIRA Server to JIRA Cloud, the local JIRA users do not retain their old passwords.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Perform a Export from a JIRA Server instance containing local users
# Import into a Cloud instance
# Try to login using the password from Server

h3. Expected Results
The users login normally.

h3. Actual Results
The user cannot login using the same password.
fields.summary: JIRA site import from Server to Cloud is not retaining passwords from users

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Some customers in JIRA Service Desk projects do not receive notifications
h3. Environment

JIRA Cloud
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a service desk project in JIRA 
 # Use a custom email address (support@foo.com) in the Project Notifications Section. 
 # Perform an action which will trigger a notification to be sent to the customer in JIRA Service Desk project. 
 # Email is sent out to the customer 
 # Email is sent as follows - the email is sent from [jira@foo.atlassian.net|mailto:jira@foo.atlassian.net] and sender is labelled as (support@foo.com)

 

*note* - [support@foo.com|mailto:support@foo.com] and foo.atlassian.net are examples
h3. Expected Results

Customer receives email 
h3. Actual Results

Some customers don't receive notifications. The customers who are able to receive the notification see the following information in the email headers.  
{noformat}
Received-SPF: softfail (google.com: domain of transitioning support@foo.com does not designate 165.254.226.149 as permitted sender) client-ip=165.254.226.149;
Authentication-Results: mx.google.com;
       spf=softfail (google.com: domain of transitioning support@foo.com does not designate 165.254.226.149 as permitted sender) smtp.mailfrom=support@foo.com
Received: from foo.atlassian.net (foo.atlassian.net.internal [10.84.168.232])
by emx-106-1.sc1.uc-inf.net (Postfix) with ESMTP id 8E4D88138A{noformat}
h3. Notes

The customers who don't receive fall in the category where their Mail Server uses a filter which blocks notifications assuming that it is an unwanted email.

This happens because the emails originate in atlassian.net IP addresses and these are not valid senders for the custom email address domain.  

Email services like (gmail, hotmail are not affected at the moment). 

Also the recipient has no way to knowing that they are missing emails unless communicated via another channel. 
h3. Workaround

Remove the custom email address from JIRA and revert to the default one (jira@foo.atlassian.net)
fields.summary: JIRA notifications are being blocked by Mail Filters

fields.description:
h2.Summary
A few instances are affected by an issue where their filters are not being loaded if the user is using Safari.

h2. Browser
Safari Release 21

h2.Workaround
Use other browsers as workaround, like Chrome.
fields.summary: JIRA filters are not being loaded on Safari

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When editing the text color by using the Editor panel for existing coloured text, the color does not change as expected.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Put some text in the comment box
# Highlight the text and edit the color by using the "Text Color" on Editor Panel
!Screenshot1.jpeg|thumbnail!
# Then, use the "Text Color" drop-down list to change it to a different color

h3. Expected Result
The Text should change to the latest chosen color.

h3. Actual Result
A new color tag is added inside the existing color tag. Example:
On Step 2:
{code}
{color:red}colored text{color}
{code}
On Step 3:
{code}
{color:red}{color:#333333}colored text{color}{color}
{code}
So, the color of the text remain unchanged.

h3. Workaround
Manually change the color tag.
fields.summary: Edit Text Color Not Working as Expected

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When cloning a ticket in JIRA, if it has several subtasks, multiple clones of it will be created as well as clones of the subtasks. Also, not all subtasks will be cloned, so deleting the other extra clones doesn't provide the same result as cloning should provide.

The number of clones it will create seems to vary depending on the instance and number of subtasks, but we were able to get 2 or 3 clones instead of the expected 1 clone. This doesn't happen when not including subtasks or when the ticket has only a few subtasks.

Tests in a clean instance show:
# Cloning a parent ticket with 151 subtasks: the parent is cloned twice
#* In this test, the subtasks for first parent clone were all cloned while for the second parent, only 42 were cloned
# Clone a parent ticket with 500 subtasks: resulted in three clones
#* Parent clones had this number of cloned subtasks: 500, 184 and 323

Not always do a parent clone have all its subtasks cloned, though.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a ticket
# Add several subtasks to it (say 150 or 500)
#* It's possible to use a script that adds the tickets via REST API
# Clone the parent

h3. Expected Results
The parent and all subtasks are cloned only once.

h3. Actual Results
The tickets are cloned more than once and we see these errors in the JIRA logs:
{noformat}
2017-02-02 18:33:52.135789500 2017-02-02 18:33:52,134 Caesium-1-3 ERROR sysadmin     [c.a.j.bc.issue.CloneIssueRunner] While executing 10301 identified task to be in state FAILED

2017-02-02 18:33:52.135799500       at com.atlassian.jira.bc.issue.CloneIssueRunner.runTask(CloneIssueRunner.java:169)
2017-02-02 18:33:52.135799500       at com.atlassian.jira.task.progress.ProgressAwareMessageRunner.processMessage(ProgressAwareMessageRunner.java:87)
2017-02-02 18:33:52.135799500       at com.atlassian.messagequeue.internal.scheduler.SchedulerMessageRunnerService$AmqJobRunner.processNestedMessage(SchedulerMessageRunnerService.java:206)
2017-02-02 18:33:52.135803500       at com.atlassian.messagequeue.internal.scheduler.SchedulerMessageRunnerService$AmqJobRunner.runJob(SchedulerMessageRunnerService.java:163)
2017-02-02 18:33:52.135803500       at com.atlassian.scheduler.core.JobLauncher.runJob(JobLauncher.java:179)

{panel:title=Update 31st March 2016}
We have identified the issue and fix is ready to be roll out to affected customers during daily maintenance. Please reach out to support if you want the fix to be applied to the instance directly. Please anticipate for 15 minutes of down time in case of manual fix application.
{panel}

Discovered at 30th March 2016 and only affects *Cloud Subscription*.

Some instances will encounters the following error when subscribing to an Add-on.

{noformat}
An unexpected error occurred. Refer to the logs for more information.
{noformat}

h3. Expected behavior

To be able to subscribe to the add-ons without fail

h3. Actual behavior

The error above is returned

h3. Additional information

We are still working on identifying the cause of this issue. Please watch this bug ticket for latest update. For urgent cases, please reach out to us at support.atlassian.com

fields.summary: New Issue Collector URLs are incorrect

fields.description:
When creating a user using REST (POST /rest/api/2/user/application) the application is set to "JIRA Software", while the default application access is configured as "None".

A workaround is not available, because the field "applicationKeys" is not allowed on cloud (Error message: "Application access permissions cannot be modified via REST in Cloud."). Also the /rest/api/2/user/application API delete function does not work and results in a http 405 error.

Update: This is affecting *POST /rest/api/3/user* too. Newly created users will be added into *Default Access Group* regardless of disabling _New users have access to this product_ under product access user administration page.
fields.summary: Default application access is not respected when creating user with REST API

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When exporting a JIRA issue to a Word document, XML, or printable format, any linked issues linked as web links do not show up.

h3. Environment
Cloud



h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a new issue
# Link one issue as a relates to issue
# Link one issue as a web link e.g., from another JIRA instance (different URL)


h3. Expected Results

The export should show all linked issues regardless of how they have been linked


h3. Actual Results

Only internally linked issues will be displayed
Any issues linked as web links will not show up
fields.summary: Web links not rendered when exporting JIRA issue to XML, Word, or printable format

fields.description:
# On a cloud instance 
# Go to services page  ie. https://yuting.atlassian.net/secure/admin/ViewServices!default.jspa

Expect

Actual
Page not found

fields.description: I need to remove the "TEST" drop down from the JIRA Header. We are using TestRail not Zephyr and it is confusing people.  See screen shot.  I have spent some time and I could not find a solution.
fields.summary: Need to Remove 'Test' from the Header
JIRA asks for setting user avatar as part of onboarding when it's already set with Aa
CORS not supported in JIRA Cloud REST API but not mentioned in documentation

fields.description:
How to reproduce:

# Go to the report section of a project
# Click on "Switch Report". A popup menu appears where you can select a report
# Select any report. I selected "Sprint Report"
# Click on "Switch Report" again.
>> The popup menu is not showing properly (See attached screenshot)

As a workaround, click on "Reports" again.

I am using Chrome 49 on Mac OS X 10.11.4. I am using JIRA Cloud, not sure what version it is running currently, I will assume 7.1.4 since that is the current most recent release.
fields.summary: "Switch Report" popup menu has incorrect z-order sometimes

fields.description:
h3. Summary
'Switch filter' link has no filter options after clicking it for second time.

h3. Steps to Reproduce 
- Open a board
- Go to 'Issues' view
- Click on 'Switch filter'
- Choose a filter
- Click on 'Switch filter' and no result will be returned

h3. Environment
7.2.0-OD-05-022

h3. Expected Results
 !Screen Shot 2016-04-04 at 9.53.54 AM.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual Results
 !Screen Shot 2016-04-04 at 9.54.30 AM.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workarounds
Refresh the page

*** This also occurs with the 'Activity' tab in the Project Summary page when you switch to Statistics, then attempt to switch back.
fields.summary: Switch filter is blank

fields.description:
h4. Summary

User unable to see dropdown menu when clicking Dashboards, projects and issue when viewing an issue.

 
h4. Step to replicate
 # Open JIRA in Firefox
 # Open an issue
 # Click on Dashboards, projects and issue

 
h4. Observed behaviour

The dropdown menu does not appear.

 
h4. Expected behaviour

!d.png|thumbnail!

 
h4. Workaround

Use other browser such as Chrome and Safari.
fields.summary: Menu bar is not clickable in Firefox when view issue screen

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Transition parent issue does not work. When a sub task is transitioned and a post function is added to transition the parent, the parent does not transition

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Add a *Transition parent issue* post function in a transition
# Run the transition

h3. Expected Results
Parent issue is transitioned.
h3. Actual Results
Parent issue is not transitioned.

h3.Workaround
Need to manually transition parent issue
fields.summary: Transition parent issue post funtion does not work

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Issue collector isn't collecting browser info any longer.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create an Issue Collector on a project
# Make sure the "Collect browser info" option is checked (it is checked by default)
# Save the issue collector and use its HTML code to create an issue on JIRA

h3. Expected Results
When you navigate to the issue created by the issue collector, the collected browser info should be displayed.
h3. Actual Results
No browser info is displayed on the issue created by the issue collector
fields.summary: Issue Collector isn't collecting browser info

fields.description:
h3. Summary Unable to Add Watchers if accessing Issue directly

h3. Steps to Reproduce

Step 1: Login to an instance with JIRA Cloud
Step 2: Access an Issue that's not Reported by you directly from Home screen
	* (Issues -> Recent Issues from outside of the Issue screen)
	* (Search for an issue directly)
	* (Click on a link directly to an issue)

Step 3: Click on Watchers and Observe

h3. Expected Results

The Add Watchers bar present

h3. Actual Results

The Add Watchers bar is missing

h3. Notes
I went ahead and included a video of the bug and the various reproduction options.

h3.Workaround
Access the Issue directly, then click on the same issue under the Issues -> Recent Issues dropdown
fields.summary: Unable to Add Watchers if accessing Issue directly

fields.description:
Repro steps:
# Go to the detail page for an epic that has child issues
# Select 'Create Sub-Task' from the dropdown menu next to one of the child issues
# Create the sub-task

*Expected:* Subtask is parented to the child issue we selected
*Actual*: Subtask is parented to the epic
fields.summary: Subtask parent wrong when created from epic issues list dropdown

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Attach files menu is shown twice under More dropdown menu. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to any issue in JIRA - make sure to have permission to attach file
# Click *More* and observe the *Attach Files* option

h3. Expected Results
Should be only one option.

h3. Actual Results
JIRA providing 2 options for attaching files.

 !attach_files.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Attach files menu is shown twice under More dropdown

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Invalid date format error displayed when trying to use the "Between" date in the Search Issue Navigator of JIRA with the "Resolution Date"
!invalidDate.png|thumbnail!
 
h3. Environment
JIRA

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to the Issue navigator of JIRA;
# Switch to basic mode of search;
# Add the Resolution Date to the search and select "Between"
# Use the date format as suggested: dd-MMM-yyyy

h3. Expected Results
The search should work just fine and provide the list of issues within this range

h3. Actual Results
It doesn't work and the following error appears:
{code}
Invalid date format. Please enter the date in the format "d/MMM/yy".
{code}
 
h3.Workaround
Use a date format as suggested by the error message:
* dd/MMM/yyyy
fields.summary: Invalid date format when using "Between" for the Resolution date in issue search

fields.description:
h3. Summary
JIRA Cloud Imports are currently failing, when trying to perform an import after the 'update URLs' step the page takes forever to load and eventually throws a page unavailable error. 

h3. Steps to reproduce 
# Perform JIRA import with backup file of > 5MB in size
# Select on _Update URLs_ OR _Skip this step_ 

h3. Expected result
JIRA will proceed with the import

h3. Actual result
Page Unavailable error is showing on the UI after updating URL step
fields.summary: JIRA Cloud Imports failing due to log spam

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Users are not able to access project which they are granted access from the android app. However, they are able to access the projects after accessing them through the browser first.
h3. Environment
(Optional - If Applicable)
* Version 1000.789.5

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Access a new access granted project in the android app

h3. Expected Results
Project accessed successfully
h3. Actual Results
Users would not be able to access the project


h3.Workaround
Users would need to access the project through a browser first and then would be able to access it from the app.
fields.summary: Users are not able to access projects which they have permission

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Similar to JRA-62859, when you try to escape an special character (in this case, the brackets), JIRA will ignore the search, or display an issue when trying to do it. For example, by using the following syntax:

!template.png|width=175,height=30!
h3. It will display words with the "Template" text within them, but, the purpose would be to retrieve only words including the brackets in them. In our example,"[Template]". Also, if you try to use only the following syntax:

{{ "summary ~ "[template]"}}

It will display the following warning:

!warning.png|thumbnail!

 
h3. Environment

JIRA Cloud

 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to the search of issue, in your JIRA instance.
 # Try to use one of the syntaxes above, but, changing the words to the examples that you have in the instance, instead of "Template".

h3. Expected Results

JIRA will find the words using the brackets around them.
h3. Actual Results

Depending on the syntax: The results will ignore words with brackets around them, and find all the words that have the same letter. If trying to search specifically for it, only with the second syntax, it will display the mentioned issue in the screenshot above.

 
h3.  
h3. Workaround

There's no workaround for the operation.
fields.summary: Escaping Brackets Do Not Retrieve Search Results

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When creating tickets/comments in JIRA via email, if an attachment is added to the email processed by JIRA, this attachment is added to the created/commented ticket as well.

For most attachment types, this is not a problem, but PDFs are failing to be previewed in the issue when added this way when using a Gmail account (not tested in others) as Email Server accessed by JIRA (not the user's source email).

This is happening because JIRA registered the ‘mime type’ for attachments in the ‘fileattachment’ table. All attachments added by email have a mime type in uppercase for some reason. 

For most attachments, this is not a problem, but JIRA is not able to preview PDFs with uppercase in mime type.

*Tested with other file extensions:*
* png
* bmp
* jpg
* tiff


h3. Environment
This was only tested with Gmail in external emails.
This was also only tested in JIRA Cloud. The default handler that comes with JIRA Cloud does not cause this problem, but connecting to Gmail causes it.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a test Gmail account
# Create a JIRA Cloud
# Create an Email Server connecting to the Gmail account and a handler to process the emails and create comments
# Send an email message with a PDF attached to the Gmail account to either create a new ticket or comment and existing one
# Navigate to the issue and click the PDF attachment

h3. Expected Results
The issue created/commented has a PDF attachment that when clicked previews the PDF in the browser (doesn’t download it).

h3. Actual Results
The PDF attachment is not identified as PDF, cannot be previewed and when clicked causes the file to be downloaded, not previewed.
 
h3. Notes
Here’s is the difference between a PDF added via email and added in the UI:
{code:sql}
jira=# select * from fileattachment where issueid in (select jiraissue.id from jiraissue join project on jiraissue.project = project.id where project.pkey = 'TP' and jiraissue.issuenum = 1);
   id | issueid | mimetype | filename | created | filesize | author | zip | thumbnailable 
------+---------+-----------------+--------------------------------+----------------------------+----------+----------+-----+---------------
10004 |   10000 | application/pdf | pdf_added_in_ui.pdf            | 2016-01-27 19:45:09.801-02 |    20597 | sysadmin |     |             0
10002 |   10000 | APPLICATION/PDF | pdf-attached_email.pdf         | 2016-01-27 19:30:41.117-02 |    20597 | admin    |     |             0
{code}

The first one can be previewed when clicked, while the second one when clicked in the issue is downloaded. 

Also, if you take a PDF that is working (can be preview and its mime type is in lowercase in the database) and change the mime type to uppercase and re-index JIRA, this PDF will have the same problem as the ones added by email. This shows that indeed the uppercase is what prevents these attachments from being previewed.

h3.Workaround
None so far.
fields.summary: Mime types for email attachments are in uppercase and PDFs fail to be previewed

fields.description:
h3. Steps to reproduce
# Trigger a backup from the Backup Manager on a Cloud instance that has more than one "Remote Crowd Directory" in {{cwd_directory}} (i.e. it's been previously imported from a Cloud instance)

h3. Expected results
The backup completes with no errors.

h3. Actual results
The backup _does_ successfully complete but with a number of these errors in the logs:

{code:none}
2016-06-27 12:13:10,813 Long running task: OnDemandBackup ERROR jashmore 733x20059x7 g6x0cn 59.167.133.100 /rest/obm/1.0/runbackup [c.a.o.backupmanager.service.BackupEntityChangesProvider] Unable to find Entity [Membership] by WhereClausule: directory_id = (select id from cwd_directory where directory_name='Remote Crowd Directory')
org.ofbiz.core.entity.GenericDataSourceException: SQL Exception while executing the following:SELECT ID FROM public.cwd_membership WHERE directory_id = (select id from cwd_directory where directory_name='Remote Crowd Directory') (ERROR: more than one row returned by a subquery used as an expression)
	at org.ofbiz.core.entity.jdbc.SQLProcessor.executeQuery(SQLProcessor.java:641)
	at org.ofbiz.core.entity.GenericDAO.createEntityListIterator(GenericDAO.java:967)
	at org.ofbiz.core.entity.GenericDAO.selectListIteratorByCondition(GenericDAO.java:883)
	at org.ofbiz.core.entity.GenericDAO.selectByCondition(GenericDAO.java:798)
	at org.ofbiz.core.entity.GenericDAO.selectByCondition(GenericDAO.java:777)
	at org.ofbiz.core.entity.GenericHelperDAO.findByCondition(GenericHelperDAO.java:178)
	at org.ofbiz.core.entity.GenericDelegator.findByCondition(GenericDelegator.java:1085)
	at com.atlassian.ondemand.backupmanager.service.BackupEntityChangesProvider.findEntityIds(BackupEntityChangesProvider.java:215)
	at com.atlassian.ondemand.backupmanager.service.BackupEntityChangesProvider.parseBackupEntityChange(BackupEntityChangesProvider.java:194)
	at com.atlassian.ondemand.backupmanager.service.BackupEntityChangesProvider.loadFromXml(BackupEntityChangesProvider.java:153)
	at com.atlassian.ondemand.backupmanager.service.BackupEntityChangesProvider.<init>(BackupEntityChangesProvider.java:56)
	at com.atlassian.ondemand.backupmanager.service.JiraBackupService.backup(JiraBackupService.java:125)
	at com.atlassian.ondemand.backupmanager.rest.OnDemandBackupTask.run(OnDemandBackupTask.java:84)
	at com.atlassian.ondemand.backupmanager.longrunning.ManagedTask.run(ManagedTask.java:35)
	at java.util.concurrent.Executors$RunnableAdapter.call(Executors.java:511)
	at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask.run(FutureTask.java:266)
	at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor.runWorker(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:1142)
	at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:617)
	at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:745)
Caused by: org.postgresql.util.PSQLException: ERROR: more than one row returned by a subquery used as an expression
	at org.postgresql.core.v3.QueryExecutorImpl.receiveErrorResponse(QueryExecutorImpl.java:2157)
	at org.postgresql.core.v3.QueryExecutorImpl.processResults(QueryExecutorImpl.java:1886)
	at org.postgresql.core.v3.QueryExecutorImpl.execute(QueryExecutorImpl.java:255)
	at org.postgresql.jdbc2.AbstractJdbc2Statement.execute(AbstractJdbc2Statement.java:555)
	at org.postgresql.jdbc2.AbstractJdbc2Statement.executeWithFlags(AbstractJdbc2Statement.java:417)
	at org.apache.tomcat.dbcp.dbcp2.DelegatingPreparedStatement.executeQuery(DelegatingPreparedStatement.java:82)
	at org.apache.tomcat.dbcp.dbcp2.DelegatingPreparedStatement.executeQuery(DelegatingPreparedStatement.java:82)
	at org.ofbiz.core.entity.jdbc.SQLProcessor.executeQuery(SQLProcessor.java:633)
	... 18 more
{code}

And using this backup created for a restore on JIRA Server will not have the any users in the internal directory. 

h3. Notes
From [~mlassau]:
{quote}
It is running an invalid SQL query:

{code}
SELECT ID 
FROM public.cwd_membership 
WHERE directory_id = (select id from cwd_directory where directory_name='Remote Crowd Directory')
{code}

The problem is the inner query: it is finding more than one row in cwd_directory that is a Remote Crowd directory.
This would make sense if you eg import data from server that already had a Remote Crowd Directory because JIRA OD will add another one during import and deactivate all previous user directories.

The query should be looking for the one and only directory that is active.
It should maybe even do some "integrity checking" up front.
{quote}

h2. Workaround

To remove the additional user directory and generate the backup again. Please contact support if you need help to apply the workaround.
fields.summary: SQL errors thrown during Cloud export when more than one Remote Crowd Directory exists

fields.description:
At present, there are connectivity issues with the back-end systems in Cloud that handle attachments and as a result attachments on issues or pages can't be uploaded or downloaded. Our infrastructure team are investigating as a high priority, further updates will be provided on this ticket.

Errors messages you may see will mention "Back-end server is at capacity".

In addition, pages with attachments may load slowly or display error messages "the images data is missing"

fields.description:
h4. Steps
# Prepare some screens
# Prepare workflows, which use some of the screens, but leave a few unused ones
# Delete a used screen in database
# Visit "Screens" page

h4. Expectation
Unused screens are be deletable.

h4. Reality
None of the screens are deletable.
When you go to a page, that would delete a screen, e.g. {{secure/admin/ViewDeleteFieldScreen.jspa?id=11007}}, you'll see a system error with a root cause similar to:

{noformat}
Caused by: java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: Cannot find Screen with id '10100'.
	at com.atlassian.jira.workflow.WorkflowActionsBean.getFieldScreenForView(WorkflowActionsBean.java:73) [jira-api-7.2.0-OD-02-009.jar:?]
	at com.atlassian.jira.workflow.AbstractJiraWorkflow.loadFieldScreenActions(AbstractJiraWorkflow.java:417) [AbstractJiraWorkflow.class:?]
	at com.atlassian.jira.workflow.AbstractJiraWorkflow.getActionsForScreen(AbstractJiraWorkflow.java:404) [AbstractJiraWorkflow.class:?]
	at com.atlassian.jira.web.action.admin.issuefields.screens.ViewFieldScreens.hasWorkflowsIncludingDrafts(ViewFieldScreens.java:152) [ViewFieldScreens.class:?]
	at com.atlassian.jira.web.action.admin.issuefields.screens.ViewFieldScreens.isDeletable(ViewFieldScreens.java:170) [ViewFieldScreens.class:?]
	at com.atlassian.jira.web.action.admin.issuefields.screens.ViewFieldScreens.doViewDeleteFieldScreen(ViewFieldScreens.java:80) [ViewFieldScreens.class:?]
{noformat}
Note that the screen id mentioned in the stacktrace is different from the one requested in the URI.

h4. Explanation
When JIRA checks whether a screen is deletable it checks, it:
# loads all transitions of all workflows (including drafts)
# filters transitions bound to the given screen

The step #1 can fail if there are transitions, which are bound to nonexistent screens.
JIRA doesn't use database relations, but instead uses defensive programming. It should be defensive in this case as well.
fields.summary: Screen deletability check fails upon a corrupted database state

fields.description:
h3. Summary
'Assigned to me' filter in the JIRA core boards isn't working as expected for the user names in brackets - e.g. User name: Charlie (Atlassian)
It also doesn't work when the user have *uppercased* letters in the username.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
1. Create a new user with brackets in the username as below
{quote}
||Full name||Username||Email Address||
|Charlie Atlassian|Charlie (Atlassian)|abc@aaa.com|
{quote}
2. Create a business project 
 3. Create new task in the business project and assign it to the new user (created in step 1)
 4. Login as the new user, and go to the business project board
 5. Click on ' Find Issues' search button at the top-right in the board
 6. Click on 'Assigned to me' filter

h3. Expected Results
User should be able to see all the tasks assigned to him/her in the board.

h3. Actual Results
User is not be able to see the new task assigned to him/her.

 
h3.Notes
Issue still persists ever after removing the brackets in the user name. i.e., changed the user name from 'Charlie (Atlassian) to 'Charlie.Atlassian' or 'Charlie Atlassian.

h3. Workaround
There is no known workaround at the moment.
fields.summary: 'Assigned to me' filter in the JIRA coreboards isn't working as expected

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When there is a need to specify a fractional value (e.g. 7.5, 8.5, etc.) in the “Working hours per day” field within the “Time tracking” administration page, JIRA allows a fractional value
 to be set, but once the change has been committed and the page is refreshed - the “Time tracking” page displays an incorrect value.  This page can be found here: https://[instancename].atlassian.net/secure/admin/TimeTrackingAdmin.jspa

 

Example:

"Working hours per day" is changed to "7.5", the change is saved, and then the page is manually refreshed.
||Setting Saved||Page Refreshed||
|!image-2017-03-17-18-01-53-345.png|width=497,height=445!|!image-2017-03-17-18-01-47-488.png|width=485,height=448!|

Despite what is shown on the page after refreshing - the value set is actually "7.5".

 

Testing shows “Working hours per day” has actually been set correctly.

!image-2017-03-17-16-40-24-366.png|width=505,height=199!
h3. Environment

JIRA 1000.824.3
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # JIRA ADMISTRATION > Issues > Issue Features: Time tracking
 # Click “Edit global settings”
 # Update "Working hours per day” to desired value (“7.5" in this case)
 # Click "Save"
 # Refresh the page: "Working hours per day" reverts back to "7"

h3. Expected Results

The “Time tracking” administration page should display the correct value
h3. Actual Results

"Working hours per day" shows incorrect value (see screenshot in table under "Page Refreshed")
h3. Notes
 * Time tracking administration page: [https://[instancename].atlassian.net/secure/admin/TimeTrackingAdmin.jspa]

h3. Workaround
 * There is no workaround
 * Log work hours on an issue as a test. "Work log" on the test issue should show "1 day" if logged work hours matches the value set in "Working hours per day"
 * Contact support if there is an unexpected result
fields.summary: "Time tracking" admin. page not showing correct value for "Working hours per day"

fields.description:
h3. Summary
It's not possible to create a JIRA issue through the mail handler if the email sender references a deleted JIRA user.

h3. Steps to reproduce:
# Create a user in JIRA.
# Delete the user.
# Use a JIRA mail handler (with default reporter) that creates issues in Projects and send an email using the deleted user email account.

_Expected results:_
JIRA should create the issue and use the default reporter as the issue reporter

_Actual results:_
JIRA does not create the email and replies the sender with the following message:
{noformat}
"Cannot create issue due to invalid license: [Sorry, you can't create any issues right now, as you need to have access to a JIRA application to be able to create issues. To gain application access you need to be a member of a group assigned to an application.]"
{noformat}

h3. Environment
Identified on JIRA Cloud.

h3. Workaround:
Recreate the user with the same credentials as before. Change the user email and delete it afterwards.
fields.summary: JIRA Mail Handler does not create issue when sender is a JIRA deleted user.

fields.description:
Deleting Large Project from JIRA, the progress stop abruptly without any error given.

h3. Steps To Replicate

# Prepare 30k issues project
# Delete the project
# Notice that there will be a progress bar indicating the process (0% complete. 7 seconds elapsed.)
# After a while (approximate a minute or two)
# It states progress unknown and refreshing it brings you back to the dialog
# Checking the project, it still exist on the JIRA instance

h3. Expected Result

Project deleted

h3. Actual Result

Project still searchable and able to access

h3. Additional information

Project actually have deducted numbers of issue, it seems that the deletion was ongoing and it stopped at some point. It does not carry any consistency on the number of issue. It sometimes delete 1000 issues, at times, it only delete 500 issues. It could be due to the instance's load at that moment.

h3. Workaround

Retry the operation for multiple time, eventually it will get the project deleted
fields.summary: Deleting Large Project Process Stop Abruptly
OnDemand backup manager causes an OOME on instances with a large amount of change history records

# Either make your browser window narrow so the More menu is displayed or lower the screen resolution
# Click on the site logo / icon
# Click More

h3. Expected Results
The sub-items of the More menu should have arrows indicating they have sub-context to choose from

h3. Actual Results
The sub-items have no arrows available
 
h3. Notes
!nomenucontext.png|thumbnail!


h3.Workaround
If a user zooms out in the browser window the sub-items return to normal
fields.summary: Sub-menu items listed in the More menu without sub-context of JIRA is viewed in a narrow browser window or resolution is too low

fields.summary: Unable to create new mail handler

fields.description:
When importing our Pivotal Tracker projects into JIRA on *.atlassian.net, a changed status name caused subsequent imports to fail.

ImportingSteps to reproduce:
# Import a project from Pivotal Tracker
# Determine that the status "IceBox" is silly and change it to "Icebox" within one of your workflows
# Import a second project from Pivotal Tracker
# Import will fail (see error log below, although it is slightly different than the first time that actually mentioned the status name it failed on 'IceBox'.)
# Change the name back to "IceBox"
# Import will succeed

Speculation: Capitalization matters and will jam up an import if different?

{quote}

fields.description:
h3. Summary

JIRA failing to proceed with workflow scheme migration for a project due to big number of issue types. In JIRA logs, below error is observed:
{noformat}
com.atlassian.messagequeue.MessagePayloadSizeExceededException: Message runner with key: 'ProgressAwareTaskService:com.atlassian.jira.workflow.migration.WorkflowSchemeMigrationTaskRunner' invoked with payload that is above the max size of 32768
	 at com.atlassian.messagequeue.Message.<init>(Message.java:32)
	 at com.atlassian.messagequeue.Message.create(Message.java:68)
	 at com.atlassian.jira.task.progress.ProgressAwareTaskServiceImpl.submitTaskLogic(ProgressAwareTaskServiceImpl.java:164)
	 at com.atlassian.jira.task.progress.ProgressAwareTaskServiceImpl.access$000(ProgressAwareTaskServiceImpl.java:32)
	 at com.atlassian.jira.task.progress.ProgressAwareTaskServiceImpl$1.submitTask(ProgressAwareTaskServiceImpl.java:235)
	 at com.atlassian.jira.task.progress.ProgressAwareTaskServiceImpl.submitTask(ProgressAwareTaskServiceImpl.java:111)
	 at com.atlassian.jira.workflow.migration.AbstractWorkflowSchemeMigrationHelper.migrateAsync(AbstractWorkflowSchemeMigrationHelper.java:447)
{noformat}

h3. Steps to reproduce
# Create a lot of issue types - about 300.
# Have a project with only a few of the issue types e.g. 5 issue types.
# Migrate the project's workflow scheme to a different one.

h3. Expected result
JIRA should be able to migrate the workflow scheme based on how many issue types used by the project.

h3. Current result
JIRA take all issue types into consideration when its workflow scheme needs to be changed causing the failure.
fields.summary: JIRA failing to proceed with workflow scheme migration for a project due to big number of issue types

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Viewing users in User Management will list down all users inclucing active and pending invitation. However it will not show the user(s) with pending invitation when choosing 'Pending Invitation' dropdown.  

h3. Environment
* Jira Cloud 1000.670.2 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to User Management > Users
# Select Active users or Clear selected items
# Select All access levels > it will show results including user(s) with pending invitation
# Select Pending invitation > pending invitation user(s) did not show 

h3. Expected Results
When Pending invitation is selected, it should show user(s) with pending invitation

h3. Actual Results
Pending invitation user(s) did not shown
 
h3. Notes
Getting the same result when tested in both Chrome and Fierefox 

h3.Workaround
no workaround
fields.summary: Users with Pending invitation not listed on the filter

fields.description:
{panel:title=Atlassian Status as of 11 January 2016|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#3C78B5| titleBGColor=#3C78B5| bgColor=#E7F4FA}
Hi all,

This has been investigated and determined to be working as designed. This change was introduced in the 7.1-OD-03 release on the 5th of January as part of the work done in ID-63 so that users will by default be directed to applications they have access to.

The workarounds given below will allow a site administrator to access the same landing page as the previous JIRA version.

At this point we consider this issue resolved. If you have any questions, please contact Atlassian Support.

Regards,

Richard Cordova
JIRA Site Reliability Engineer
{panel}

h3. Summary

We've noticed some Cloud instances redirecting to User Management instead of JIRA. This happens to Site Administrators with no Access to JIRA.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Log in as a Site Administrator without Application Access to JIRA

h3. Expected Results
The user is redirected to JIRA

h3. Actual Results
User is redirected to User Management (https://instance.atlassian.net/admin) or Confluence, if the instance has it
 
h3. Notes
This is a different behavior from before, probably changed on the update on Jan/5/2016

h3.Workaround
To access JIRA, go to:
https://instance.atlassian.net/secure/Dashboard.jspa
or grant the affected user *Application Access* to JIRA Core, Software or Service Desk.
fields.summary: Site administrators without Application Access are redirecting to User Management or Confluence instead of JIRA

fields.description:
h3. Summary

The releases page cannot be viewed in Internet Explorer 11. 

h3. Environment
* JIRA Cloud
* Internet Explorer 11 (Edge)

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to a project with that has a 'releases' menu item
# Click on the 'releases' menu 

h3. Expected Results
The releases page is displayed with release information
 !Working-Chrome.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual Results
The releases page shows the loading image indefinitely
 !Loading-IE11.png|thumbnail! 

In the console you can see the following error:
{noformat}
Object doesn't support property or method 'startsWith'
File: com.atlassian.jira.jira-projects-plugin:abstract-list-page.js, Line: 101, Column: 1148{noformat}
 !Error-IE11.png|thumbnail! 
 
h3.Workaround
Use another browser such as Google Chrome
fields.summary: The 'Releases' page appears to load indefinitely when using Internet Explorer 11

Welcome to the administration of your demonstration project!

This is where you can view and change how the project is configured. Use the tabs on the left to navigate to different project settings.

fields.summary: Html encoding issue in example business project

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:
# Log in
# Open a ticket
# Select the Description field to edit it
# Enter a line a text en below a bullet list (with "*" or "-" as markup)
# Check the preview => the bullet list is directly under the text, no spacing
# Save the description => there is now extra space between the text and the bullet list

*Problem:* the extra space impairs the readability of the text, especially when it contains a mix of paragraphs and bullet lists.

*Expected result:* the bullet list should be directly under the text, without spacing, just the way it is rendered as preview.

See attached screenshots.
fields.summary: Bullet lists under a line of text are rendered incorrectly in saved view

fields.description:
h3. Summary

The filters are not behaving as they should in JIRA when using the filter ID directly since they are not respecting the ORDER BY statement.

h3. Environment
h3. Cloud JIRA v1000.499.4


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Search for filter using the filter ID
 # You must have at least two issues and set their order to be displayed in a different way than the default.
 # I'll use my own test instance as an example, use this URL: [https://pece.atlassian.net/issues/?jql=filter%3D10100]
 # You can see that it's using the filter settled before, but not respecting the ORDER BY statement
 # Using in this form it works: [https://pece.atlassian.net/issues/?filter=10100]
 # Also, as a workaround we can specific the ORDER BY: https://pece.atlassian.net/issues/?jql=filter%20%3D%2010100%20ORDER%20BY%20createdDate%20ASC

h3. Expected Results

JIRA jql must respect the filter requirements like ORDER BY when calling the filter directly through URL

h3. Actual Results
The ORDER BY statement is not being respected.
 
h3.Workaround
Specify the filter ORDER BY statement like this:

https://pece.atlassian.net/issues/?jql=filter%20%3D%2010100%20ORDER%20BY%20createdDate%20ASC
fields.summary: Filters are not behaving as designed

h3. Summary
Trying to change the Resolution of an issue at the Issue Creation transition using JIRA built in Post function does not work.
h3. Environment
Cloud - 1000.824.3

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Set a workflow and put a Post function on it to change the issue Resolution
# Create an issue

h3. Expected Results
The Resolution should be changed.

h3. Actual Results
The Resolution doesn't change. 

h3. Notes
Works fine for other transitions.
The order of the post functions doesn't matter.

h3.Workaround
Set the resolution after creating the issue.
fields.summary: Cannot change Resolution of JIRA issues in the Create Issue Transition.

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Specifying thumbnail dimensions in a wiki markup field (such as 'Description) no longer works. If a thumbnail is used, it will stay the same default size no matter what changes you make. The format used to change the size has always been: 
Example-
{code}
!foo.jpg|thumbnail,width=40px!
{code}

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Add an attachment to an issue
# Insert a thumbnail into the description field and attempt to specify width and/or height. No changes take place.

h3.Workaround
Use the width=, but leave the thumbnail text out. The problem though is that the thumbnail can no longer be selected/enlarged. So this workaround is not a true fix.
fields.summary: Specifying Thumbnail Size no longer works

# Add the Projects gadget
# Select projects or categories (3 is best to assure that 3 columns must be shown)
# *Number of columns* select 3 and click save

h3. Expected Results
3 Columns with issues are shown.

h3. Actual Results
Just 2 columns are shown.
 
h3.Workaround
There's no workaround at the moment
fields.summary: Projects gadget not showing third column

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Accessing the {{/rest/auth/1/session}} in some cases returns 3, rather then the expected 2 cookies. Additionally, the extra cookie has a blank value but no expiration date. 
E.g.
{noformat}
studio.crowd.tokenkey=""; Domain=.foo.atlassian.net; Expires=Thu, 01-Jan-1970 00:00:10 GMT; Path=/; Secure; HttpOnly
studio.crowd.tokenkey=REDACTED; Domain=.foo.atlassian.net; Path=/; Secure; HttpOnly
studio.crowd.tokenkey=;Version=1;Secure; HttpOnly
{noformat}



h3. Environment
1000.784.2

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Call the session endpoint with curl using the {{-D-}} option to print the header. E.g.
{{curl -D- -H "Content-Type: application/json" -c cookie.txt -d '{"username":"USERNAME", "password":"PASSWORD" }' -X POST https://INSTANCE_URL/rest/auth/1/session}}



h3. Expected Results
2 cookies are returned

h3. Actual Results
3 cookies are returned, and the last one has a blank value and no expiration date:
{noformat}
studio.crowd.tokenkey=""; Domain=.foo.atlassian.net; Expires=Thu, 01-Jan-1970 00:00:10 GMT; Path=/; Secure; HttpOnly
studio.crowd.tokenkey=REDACTED; Domain=.foo.atlassian.net; Path=/; Secure; HttpOnly
studio.crowd.tokenkey=;Version=1;Secure; HttpOnly
{noformat}
 
h3. Notes
This issue only happens to instances that are using the old authentication system

h3.Workaround
The current workaround is to ignore the blank cookie (it should not be returned at all).
fields.summary: JIRA /rest/auth/1/session endpoint returns a redundant empty cookie

fields.description:
*Steps to Reproduce*
# Create a component
# Click on the component link

*Expected Result*
Component link works as expected

*Actual Result*
The link doesn't load

*Workaround*
# Right click on the Component link and open new tab
# Use other browser (i.e Mozilla Firefox)
fields.summary: Component link doesn't load when using Chrome and Safari
